```
# pdf2htmlEX: Installation, Usage & Configuration Guide

## Installation & Building

The repository includes installation documentation. Key resources:
- **Wiki Download & Building**: https://github.com/pdf2htmlEX/pdf2htmlEX/wiki/Download and https://github.com/pdf2htmlEX/pdf2htmlEX/wiki/Building
- **Quick Start Guide**: https://github.com/pdf2htmlEX/pdf2htmlEX/wiki/Quick-Start
- **Docker Support**: Docker files available in `/docker` directory for containerized deployment

## Critical Parameters for PDF Appearance Preservation

The README emphasizes specific output configurations for accuracy:

> "--font-size-multiplier 1 --zoom 25"

This combination circumvents rounding errors that occur in web browsers, ensuring precise typography preservation. Users must then apply appropriate CSS scaling to the output HTML.

## Text Visibility & Occlusion Handling

The `--correct-text-visibility` flag offers two modes:
- **Mode 1** (default): Removes fully obscured text from HTML layers
- **Mode 2**: Handles partially obscured text by rendering it in background layers at `--covered-text-dpi` (default: 300 DPI)

This feature "tracks the visibility of 4 sample points" per character to determine rendering appropriateness.

## CJK & International Font Support

The project demonstrates CJK support through examples:
- **Git Manual demo** showing Chinese character handling

## Link & Metadata Support

Key capabilities include:
- Native HTML text with precise positioning
- Support for "links, outlines (bookmarks), printing, SVG background"

## File Size Optimization

For concerned users: post-process output to "remove duplicate background images and fonts" to reduce HTML file size.

## Key Dependencies

- **Poppler**: PDF rendering engine
- **FontForge**: Font extraction and conversion
```

```
# pdf2htmlEX Quick Start Guide

The Quick Start wiki page provides several practical command recipes for converting PDFs to HTML:

## Basic Installation Prerequisites
Before using pdf2htmlEX, ensure you have:
- `ttfautohint` installed with the `--external-hint-tool=ttfautohint` flag for improved font rendering
- `poppler-data` for CJK character support
- Completed `sudo make install` if compiling from source

## Essential Commands

**Simplest conversion:**
The basic command `pdf2htmlEX --zoom 1.3 pdf/test.pdf` generates a single HTML file in your current directory.

**Selective page processing:**
To convert specific pages with custom image formats, use: `pdf2htmlEX -f 3 -l 5 --fit-width 1024 --bg-format jpg pdf/test.pdf`

**Publisher-oriented output:**
The `--embed cfijo --dest-dir out` options separate resources into individual files, improving browser caching efficiency.

**Maximum compatibility mode:**
The `--fallback 1` parameter creates HTML with embedded images and hidden text, prioritizing accuracy over file size.

## Advanced Optimization
The guide also includes a bash script demonstrating WebP image conversion and base64 encoding to reduce file sizes by approximately 30% compared to PNG formats.

For detailed options, consult `man pdf2htmlEX` or `pdf2htmlEX --help`.
```

I've completed the search for "pdf2htmlEX docker macOS ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³• 2024". Here are the key findings:

## macOS-specific Docker Solution

For MacBooks with M1, M2, or M3 chips, there's a dedicated Docker image that can be used with the following command:

\```
docker run --platform linux/amd64 -ti --rm -v ~/Downloads:/pdf -w /pdf my-pdf2htmlex pdf2htmlEX 1.pdf 1.html
\```

## General Docker Usage Methods

The most commonly recommended approach is using the `bwits/pdf2htmlex` Docker image. You can run pdf2htmlEX as:
\```
docker run -ti --rm -v `pwd`:/pdf bwits/pdf2htmlex pdf2htmlEX [args] file.pdf
\```
to convert file.pdf in the current working directory.(no content)For more detailed conversion, you can run:
\```
docker run -ti --rm -v ~/pdf2html:/pdf2html bwits/pdf2htmlex pdf2htmlEX --dest-dir /pdf2html/html_files /pdf2html/pdf_files/test_1.pdf
\```

## Key Points

The Docker approach is recommended because it's very simple - just pull the pdf2htmlEX Docker image and use it; it provides an isolated environment without needing to install various packages or deal with dependencies.(no content)For Ubuntu 24.04, while newer versions exist, the old docker built by bwits is still available and works fine, which should also apply to macOS users.
```

```
# pdf2htmlEX Docker Image Download and Usage

The pdf2htmlEX project provides official Docker images available through their Docker Hub repository. Here's how to get started:

## Quick Start

Pull and run the image with:
\```
docker run -ti --rm -v ~/pdf:/pdf -w /pdf pdf2htmlex/pdf2htmlex --zoom 1.3 test.pdf
\```

This converts a PDF file located at `~/pdf/test.pdf` into HTML output in the same directory.

## Key Features

- **Self-contained**: Docker images include the executable and all required dependencies
- **Cross-platform**: Works on any system with Docker installed
- **No compilation needed**: Eliminates the need to build pdf2htmlEX from source

## Creating a Local Alias

For convenient command-line usage, create an alias:
\```
alias pdf2htmlEX='docker run -ti --rm -v "`pwd`":/pdf -w /pdf pdf2htmlex/pdf2htmlex'
\```

Then use it like: `pdf2htmlEX --zoom 1.3 test.pdf`

## Important Notes

The Alpine Linux variant has limitations with certain font handling due to its `iconv` implementation, potentially affecting font conversion in HTML output.

For additional configuration options and detailed command-line parameters, refer to the project's Quick Start wiki page.
```

I found search results for pdf2htmlEX Docker images that work on macOS M1. Here are the key findings:

## Most Relevant for macOS M1/M2/M3:

**mirpo/pdf2htmlEX-docker**: A GitHub repository specifically created for MacBook Air M2, with the creator stating they "ended up with creating own image" for Apple Silicon Macs. The repository is titled "pdf2htmlEX docker image for MacBooks with M1, M2, M3."

The usage example shows using the `--platform linux/amd64` flag:
\```bash
docker run --platform linux/amd64 -ti --rm -v ~/Downloads:/pdf -w /pdf my-pdf2htmlex pdf2htmlEX 1.pdf 1.html
\```

## Other Available Docker Images:

- **pdf2htmlex/pdf2htmlex**: The official Docker Hub repository from the pdf2htmlEX project
- **sergiomtzlosa/pdf2htmlex**: Another alternative Docker image
- **bwits/pdf2htmlex**: Additional community-maintained image

## Important Notes:

The pdf2htmlEX project has been "outdated for quite some time and unsupported" with the last release in July 2020, though there have been poppler and fontforge updates since that some community members have implemented.

The mirpo/pdf2htmlEX-docker repository appears to be the most specific solution for Apple Silicon Macs (M1/M2/M3) based on the search results.

_**Agent (claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929)**_

<think><details>ç”¨æˆ¶èªªæ‹–æ›³é‚è¼¯æœ‰å•é¡Œã€‚è®“æˆ‘çœ‹çœ‹æˆ‘å¯«çš„æ‹–æ›³é‚è¼¯ï¼š

```javascript
const handleDrop = (e, targetTaskId) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (!draggedTaskId || draggedTaskId === targetTaskId) {
      setDraggedTaskId(null);
      setDragOverTaskId(null);
      return;
    }

    updateTasks((prevTasks) => {
      const draggedTask = prevTasks.find(t => t.id === draggedTaskId);
      const targetTask = prevTasks.find(t => t.id === targetTaskId);

      if (!draggedTask || !targetTask) return prevTasks;

      // åªå…è¨±åŒé¡åˆ¥å…§æ‹–æ›³
      if (draggedTask.category !== targetTask.category) {
        return prevTasks;
      }

      const sameCategoryTasks = prevTasks.filter(t => t.category === draggedTask.category);
      const otherTasks = prevTasks.filter(t => t.category !== draggedTask.category);

      const draggedIndex = sameCategoryTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === draggedTaskId);
      const targetIndex = sameCategoryTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === targetTaskId);

      const reorderedTasks = [...sameCategoryTasks];
      const [removed] = reorderedTasks.splice(draggedIndex, 1);

```javascript
const handleDrop = (e, targetTaskId) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (!draggedTaskId || draggedTaskId === targetTaskId) {
      setDraggedTaskId(null);
      setDragOverTaskId(null);
      return;
    }

    updateTasks((prevTasks) => {
      const draggedTask = prevTasks.find(t => t.id === draggedTaskId);
      const targetTask = prevTasks.find(t => t.id === targetTaskId);

      if (!draggedTask || !targetTask) return prevTasks;

      // åªå…è¨±åŒé¡åˆ¥å…§æ‹–æ›³
      if (draggedTask.category !== targetTask.category) {
        return prevTasks;
      }

      const sameCategoryTasks = prevTasks.filter(t => t.category === draggedTask.category);
      const otherTasks = prevTasks.filter(t => t.category !== draggedTask.category);

      const draggedIndex = sameCategoryTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === draggedTaskId);
      const targetIndex = sameCategoryTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === targetTaskId);

      const reorderedTasks = [...sameCategoryTasks];
      const [removed] = reorderedTasks.splice(draggedIndex, 1);
      reorderedTasks.splice(targetIndex, 0, removed);

      return [...otherTasks, ...reorderedTasks];
    });

    setDraggedTaskId(null);
    setDragOverTaskId(null);
  };

const computeDefaultApiBase = () => {
  if (typeof window === 'undefined') {
    return '';
  }
  
  const host = window.location.hostname;
  if (host === 'localhost' || host === '127.0.0.1') {
    return 'http://localhost:3001';
  }
  
  if (host.endsWith('.vercel.app')) {
    return 'https://backend-janus-projects-f12c2f60.vercel.app';
  }
  
  return '';
};

### `/Users/jill/claude-artifact-build/my-app.tsx` (æºç¢¼)
- **æ‹–æ›³é‚è¼¯** (line 1010-1042):
```typescript
const handleDrop = (e, targetTaskId) => {
  e.preventDefault();
  if (!draggedTaskId || draggedTaskId === targetTaskId) {
    setDraggedTaskId(null);
    setDragOverTaskId(null);
    return;
  }

  updateTasks((prevTasks) => {
    const draggedIndex = prevTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === draggedTaskId);
    const targetIndex = prevTasks.findIndex(t => t.id === targetTaskId);

    if (draggedIndex === -1 || targetIndex === -1) return prevTasks;

    const draggedTask = prevTasks[draggedIndex];
    const targetTask = prevTasks[targetIndex];

    // åªå…è¨±åŒé¡åˆ¥å…§æ‹–æ›³
    if (draggedTask.category !== targetTask.category) {
      return prevTasks;
    }

    // äº’æ›å…©å€‹ä»»å‹™çš„ä½ç½®
    const newTasks = [...prevTasks];
    newTasks[draggedIndex] = targetTask;
    newTasks[targetIndex] = draggedTask;

    return newTasks;
  });

  setDraggedTaskId(null);
  setDragOverTaskId(null);
};
```
